image.altText: A person in a hazmat suit stands between two cars in a driveway, with a burnt out house in the background.

props.synopsis: Three young children have died overnight after a house fire at Lalor Park in Sydney's west.

title.children: Police allege father blocked rescuers trying to save children from fatal house fire that killed three

image.altText: Emergency services search the rocks at  Little Bay Beach after reports of a concern for welfare

props.synopsis: A search and rescue operation at Little Bay Beach located the body of the first person just after 11am on Sunday, with the second located about 1:40pm.

title.children: Two bodies found near rocks at Little Bay Beach in Sydney's south-east

image.altText: Headshot of a bald black man wearing glasses, suit and tie

props.synopsis: A minister in Papua New Guinea's government is arrested and charged with an alleged domestic assault offence after police were called to an address in Bondi.

title.children: PNG minister charged with domestic assault in Bondi

image.altText: Mehreen Faruqi refuses to be drawn on dismantling Hamas

props.synopsis: Greens deputy Mehreen Faruqi says it should be left to Palestinians to decide whether to dismantle Hamas, as she also makes claims that ex-Labor senator Fatima Payman is being "vilified" by her former party.

title.children: 'Not up to me': Greens deputy won't say whether Hamas should be dismantled

image.altText: A maritime boat in a lake.

props.synopsis: A search is underway for a missing 23-year-old man after the boat he was on overturned at Lake Macquarie. Three other men who were on the boat were saved.

title.children: Man missing, three saved after boat overturns on channel leading into lake

image.altText: Mailbox outside a derelict terrace house

props.synopsis: As Australians endure the latest acute phase of a decades-long housing crisis, why are property owners allowed to leave homes derelict and prime land vacant indefinitely?

title.children: A person's home may be their castle but if they leave it vacant can they really complain if it gets taken away?

image.altText: Facebook defamation

props.synopsis: During the COVID lockdowns, an online vigilantism soon became a defamation case in the NSW District Court. New legislation is aiming to avoid cases like this from happening again.

title.children: The 'stick lady', a frustrated cyclist and a court case that helped spark major change to defamation laws

image.altText: NRL referee Ashley Klein signals 10 minutes int he sin bin for Jared Waerea-Hargreaves of the Sydney Roosters.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Roosters host the St George Illawarra Dragons before the Raiders and Knights wrap up round 18 in Canberra, with a number of players auditioning for spots in next week's decider. Follow live.

title.children: 'That's not 10': No special treatment for JWH as he is sin-binned in milestone Roosters game despite on-field argument

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 17' Jared Waerea-Hargreaves is sin-binned in his milestone game
10' Brandon Smith making an impact early

image.altText: Christian Petracca grimaces and holds his ribs as he his led by the arm off the field by a Melbourne Demons trainer.

props.synopsis: Injured Melbourne star Christian Petracca has returned to hospital for another bout of surgery as his teammates head towards a huge win over the West Coast Eagles at the MCG. Meanwhile, St Kilda hosts Sydney at the Docklands. Follow live.

title.children: Petracca facing 'traumatic challenges' back in hospital as Melbourne hosts West Coast

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Marshall doubles up as Saints continue fast start

image.altText: cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

props.synopsis: With cost-of-living issues still at large, two experts share their view on whether rigid budgeting is the right strategy to manage household cashflow.

title.children: Three budgeting methods to help manage your cash in a cost-of-living crisis

image.altText: Margaret Campbell dressed in a fur coat clutches a purse standing next to a man dressed in a suit with a bowtie.

props.synopsis: The duke and duchess of Argyll's 20th-century divorce proceedings saw a wife slut-shamed, exiled from high society and turned into one of the earliest, most famous victims of revenge porn. Here's how the case unfolded.

title.children: Revenge porn, a crumbling castle, and the scandalous divorce that rocked British high society

image.altText: Angie King marries Eric Burdon

props.synopsis: Jet James was eight when his mother died tragically. His journey back from childhood trauma led him in an unexpected direction.

title.children: Jet's mother was a sixties model who married rock royalty but her life met a tragic end

image.altText: A woman smells the soil in her truffiere

props.synopsis: Truffle producer Tanya Moroney says the scent of the fungus infuses her home and clothes, but she's grateful for their aroma after losing her sense of smell during treatment for cancer.

title.children: A decade after temporarily losing her sense of smell, Tanya now has a nose for truffles

image.altText: A woman entering a red, white and blue voting booth

props.synopsis: Left-wing and centrist parties in France have joined forces in a bid to prevent the far right winning a majority of seats in parliament in this weekend's final round of voting. Here's your guide.

title.children: Political rivals in France are banding together to block the far right. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: George Russell, Lewis Hamilton and Lando Norris stand together

props.synopsis: It has been 56 years since British drivers have occupied the top three positions in qualifying for a Formula 1 Grand Prix, but they did so in front of their own supporters at Silverstone.

title.children: 'Incredible' F1 trio claim first all-British top three since 1968 at Silverstone

image.altText: Australian cyclist Matthew Richardson prepares for training at the Adelaide Superdrome ahead of the Paris Olympics

props.synopsis: Matthew Richardson is a former gymnast who had to give up the sport because of a devastating elbow injury, but he's now making serious waves in the velodrome and looking for Olympic gold.

title.children: Aussie cyclist Matt Richardson has a triple gold medal ambition ahead of the Paris Olympics

image.altText: Woman holds jumper with a small patch of darning

props.synopsis: While Australia overtakes the US as the largest per capita consumer of textiles, a group of nannas in the South West of WA is having a darn good go at fixing fashion waste through thrifty sewing sessions.

title.children: Nannas on the mend aim to prolong the life of clothes through free sewing lessons

image.altText: An army camouflage pattern in the background with a female silhouette in profile overlaid.

props.synopsis: The Australian Defence Force and Victoria Police confirm investigations are underway after a trainee alleges she was raped by a fellow member in 2023.

title.children: ADF and Victoria Police investigating after trainee alleges she was raped by fellow member

image.altText: A photo showing a man kicking an AFL football.

props.synopsis: Known as the "The Flash" for his breathtaking pace on the footy field in the 70s and 80s, Michael Graham's induction to the Australian Football Hall of Fame has capped off his journey from the Point Pearce mission to footballing immortality.

title.children: 'An absolute genius': How Michael 'The Flash' Graham became an AFL immortal

image.altText: A blue whale breaching the surface of the ocean, pictured from directly above.

props.synopsis: Little was known about the behaviour of the pygmy blue whale, but research that has utilised tourist footage and drones is shining a new light on their activities in waters north of Australia.

title.children: How drones and tourists offered new insights on a rare subspecies of blue whale

image.altText: A photo of man in a hat kneeling in front of sheep beside a photo of the same man standing at a wedding alter.

props.synopsis: Farmer Monty Haron has an alter ego — or some might say altar ego. One day the 29-year-old could be carting hay, and the next hitching newlyweds.

title.children: Monty moonlights as a marriage celebrant when he's not working on the farm

image.altText: A graphic shows a man and a woman against a black background adorned with Indigenous art.

props.synopsis: Black excellence and community leadership were honoured at the 2024 National NAIDOC Week Awards in Tarndanya (Adelaide) on Kaurna Yerta Country on Saturday evening.

title.children: National NAIDOC Week Awards 2024: Here are all of this year's finalists and winners

image.altText: Andre Drege rides his bike

props.synopsis: Norwegian rider André Drege crashed on a descent at the Tour of Austria, suffering fatal injuries. He was 25.

title.children: Cycling world in mourning after 25-year-old pro dies in World Tour crash

image.altText: Chrstine Cloud sits on a sofa. She is speaking.

props.synopsis: Christine Cloud never thought she'd be forced to move in with her father in retirement, but the rising cost of living is biting in Nevada. Now, she's an example of Joe Biden's big problem in the crucial swing state.

title.children: This Vegas voter is backing the 'scary' candidate. She's an example of Biden's problem in America's gambling capital

image.altText: A collage of a Qantas plane, a reward notice and a black and white photo of a mother and two children.

props.synopsis: Many Australians know the story of "Mr Brown's" 1971 Qantas bomb hoax. But few know the ongoing trauma experienced by the passengers onboard that fateful flight.

title.children: More than 50 years on, passengers of the fateful Qantas bomb hoax flight are still waiting for acknowledgement

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: So you think you're some kind of master of general knowledge? Well, I'll be the judge of that.

title.children: It's time to flex your trivia muscle. Have you got what it takes?

image.altText: Vicky Xu poses for a photo sitting on concrete steps outside.

props.synopsis: An Australian citizen, identified as a potential target of suspected foreign interference, says the AFP cut official contact with her after she complained about an alleged assault by their officers and criticised the agency in a post on X.

title.children: 'You guys suck': Target of suspected foreign interference campaign says AFP cut off contact after complaint and tweet

image.altText: A girl lights earthen lamps in the shape of a red ribbon.

props.synopsis: The Philippines has seen a 411 per cent increase in daily HIV cases in a little over a decade. Experts blame conservatism and shame.

title.children: A youth HIV epidemic is spiralling in the Philippines

image.altText: A close up photo of Caroline Jones, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Long-running Australian Story presenter Caroline Jones bequeathed $1.7m towards Indigenous high school education in her final gift to the community.

title.children: Founding Australian Story presenter Caroline Jones's $1.7m gift

image.altText: A young child gets there nose blown.

props.synopsis: Children attending child care get sick more often than those who don't, according to research. But is there light at the end of the tunnel for parents? Here's what we know about childcare illnesses, and how you can prevent your kids from getting worse this winter.

title.children: Childcare kids get sick on average 10 times a year. Here's how to help your bub get through winter

image.altText: Nicola Moriarty standing in front of a green Booktopia sign, hundreds of copies of Every Last Suspect in front of her

props.synopsis: Author Nicola Moriarty was only just at Booktopia's Sydney headquarters on May 30, signing hundreds of copies of her latest book Every Last Suspect. She's saddened the Australian book retailer has gone into voluntary administration.

title.children: Booktopia played an important role in supporting Australian authors, who are lamenting its collapse
